title: Restoring force - block on three tracks A B and C

content.description: A small block can slide with negligible friction on various tracks of different shapes, as shown in the figures. The track shapes can be described with the following equations, where <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math>, <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi></math>, and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> are positive constants with appropriate units.
content.question: Track A: <math alttext="y equals negative A, x" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>A</mi><mi>x</mi></math> Track B: <math alttext="y equals B times the absolute value of x" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>B</mi><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>, except for a small, smooth transition region near the bottom of the track Track C: <math alttext="y equals negative C times the cosine of, open parenthesis, the fraction x over D, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>C</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mi>D</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> Consider the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of the block’s motion on each track after the block is released from rest at the positions shown. For which track, if any, does the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of the block’s motion approximate simple harmonic motion?

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
